t_audio_highlights::clip_card_6::goals[0: Record the effect of the issue. Show how it impacts the community.
t_audio_highlights::text_card_1::text: You may want more clips. On each clip there is a button that looks like three vertical dots. This is the \“overflow menu.\” This button will allow you to edit your clips or duplicate the card.
t_audio_highlights::clip_card_1::goals[0: Introduce the main character(s) in your story.
t_audio_highlights::title: Highlights Audio
t_audio_highlights::clip_card_0::goals[0: Record sound of the community that your story is about.
t_audio_highlights::clip_card_3::goals[0: Record the most important element of the story.
t_audio_highlights::clip_card_4::goals[0: Record another example that illustrates the story.
t_audio_highlights::text_card_0::text: This template will help you capture the best moments in your story. Highlights stories are structured less to illustrate a clear story line and more to show the peak moments or most dramatic aspects of the topic. In audio, highlights stories are typically bracketed by the storyteller's voice.
t_audio_highlights::clip_card_7::goals[0: Has anything been done about the issue? Record the change.
t_audio_highlights::clip_card_5::goals[0: Record another important element of the story.
t_audio_highlights::clip_card_2::goals[0: Record audio that sums up the the story and its importance.
t_audio_highlights::clip_card_7::goals[1: If nothing has changed, explain that.
